intro: Sabia yunnanensis, commonly known as Yunnan sabia, is a flowering plant native to China, specifically the Yunnan province. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its flowers emit a mild fragrance. Sabia yunnanensis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices.
